entry.title: How to capture Mobile Status from SAP Service and Asset Manager (SSAM) in S/4HANA backend?
entry.content:
We are using SAP Service and Asset Manager (SSAM) 2310 for technicians to update work orders in the field. When a technician sets a Mobile Status (e.g., Completed, Started, Hold) in SSAM, I want to capture this information in the S/4HANA 2202 backend.

My goals are:

  • Identify which user updated the Mobile Status in SSAM.
  • Track how many work orders have been completed based on Mobile Status.
  • Send notifications to planners on the status updates at the end of each day. 

Questions:

  1. Is there any FIORI App that can capture this info?
    1. As of now I use Order and Operations App and filter by Changed By. But once the operation is completed, we TECO the WO that changes the value of Changed By. 
  2. Which SAP table or object stores Mobile Status updates from SSAM?
  3. How can I link Mobile Status to Work Orders and Operations in S/4HANA?
  4. Is there a standard approach or CDS view to report Mobile Status along with System Status and user details?

Any guidance or best practices would be appreciated.

TIA 

Manish Jha

entry.title: Re: SAPUI5 App Changes Not Reflected After Transport to Q...
entry.content:
Hi EBZ,

Yes, this kind of issue happens quite often when moving SAPUI5 apps from DEV to QAS. Most of the time it’s related to caching on the SAP Gateway or front-end server, not the browser itself.

You can try running a few transactions on QAS to make sure everything refreshes properly. Run UI2/INVALIDATE_CLIENT_CACHES and UI5/APP_INDEX_CALCULATE to rebuild the app index. If your app is deployed as a BSP, you can also use UI5/UPDATE_CACHEBUSTER to force the system to generate a new cache-buster token.

It’s also worth checking that the cache-buster configuration is active for your app. If it isn’t, the browser might still load the older version from its cache. Sometimes the transport request doesn’t include the cache-buster metadata files, so you might want to double-check that as well.

A good habit is to always run these invalidate and recalculate transactions after every transport. That usually prevents users from needing to clear their own caches.

Clearing the user cache fixes it temporarily because it forces a new fetch, but the long-term fix is to refresh the Gateway and make sure cache-buster is set up correctly.

I’ve helped a few teams deal with similar UI5 transport and caching issues. If you want, I can take a quick look at your setup and point you in the right direction.

entry.title: Re: View future time based maintenance plans
entry.content: Hi there, Yes, you can definitely view upcoming maintenance plan due dates in advance. In SAP S/4HANA, one of the easiest ways to do this is through transaction IP24 (Display Maintenance Plan Scheduling). It lets you see planned orders or calls for a given period you can set the selection horizon to 3–4 months or more, depending on your needs. If you want a more flexible view, you can also use IP19 for graphical analysis or create a custom report based on table MHIS or MPOS to list future scheduled calls by date and equipment. That’s often helpful when you need to plan external work or send early notifications like your Z2 ones. In some cases, organizations also build a Fiori app or dashboard to visualize future maintenance due dates across the fleet — that makes coordination with third parties much smoother. I’ve helped a few teams set up something similar in S/4HANA for fleet maintenance visibility. If you’d like, I can walk you through how to set up that forward view or report for your use case.

entry.title: Re: Project Control - Enterprise Projects
entry.content:
Good day @jantoniomoyano3 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Enhanced Enterprise Search for Enterprise Projects, Project Control - Enterprise Projects & About Spaces and Pages.

To summarise, in public cloud, once a project definition has been released, any new WBS elements you create inherit th release status of their superior element. This means if the parent project or superior WBS element is already released, new subordinate WBS elements are automatically created as released. This inheritance ensures consistency in project processing and prevents inconsistencies in posting availability (for example, time booking or procurement assignments).

In public cloud, there is no delivered configuration or BAdI to change this behaviour. A clean-core governance approach is taken in public cloud which hinders modifications. The clean approach is for you to:

  • Use Project Status Management to manually reset the WBS element to Created or Locked after creation.
  • Or, you may model your project templates so that WBS elements expected to stay unreleased are pre-created before the overall project is released.

Your observation is correct, the Related Apps menu in this Fiori page is delivered by SAP and you cannot customise it in public cloud. You can, however, create your own custom page or space by editing the SAP Fiori Launchpad, add the apps you frequently use to that custom page, alternatively, use Spaces & Pages personalization to group the projects related apps for faster navigation.

Below is short description on how you can carry out the test in your system:

Search for Project Control

Open a project that you (or) have already released --> Click Edit --> create a new WBS element à observe that the system sets the new element as Released.

You can test manual control by going to Project Status tab and change the status of the new WBS element back to Crated or Locked.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: HTTPS Sync on SQL Anywhere 17.0 SP1 PL21 Build 8228 F...
entry.content:
The release notes would also be in the root of the SQL Anywhere install.  The change that is likely at play is show below.  I am very certain that this is the cause of the behavior you are reporting. The ML server would likely be running with older ciphers and a different underlying encryption technology (openSSL)  where SQLA 17 based encryption is based on SAP Common Crypto Library.

    ================(Build ##7208  - Engineering Case##827429)===============
 
When min_tls_version=12 (default in IQ 16.1 SP05 and SQL Anywhere 17 SP1), 
earlier SHA-1 suites were still allowed. Furthermore, weaker suites that 
do not support Forward Secrecy were still allowed. This has been fixed.
When min_tls_version=12, all SHA-1 cipher suites and non-PFS suites are 
blocked. 128-bit suites are faster and considered as secure as 256-bit suites 
when coupled with strong key exchanges (HANA and external security experts 
recommendations order 128-bit before 256-bit suites). IQ and SQL Anywhere 
servers list of supported suites have been re-ordered and adjusted accordingly.
When lower TLS versions are allowed, SHA-1 and RSA key exchange suites (including 
TLS1.2 RSA key exchange suites) are allowed.
When the minimum TLS version is 1.2, the supported cipher suites are:
     * TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 (secp384r1)
     * TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 (secp384r1)
     * TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256 (secp384r1)
     * TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384 (secp384r1)
 
When the minimum TLS version is 1.1 or 1.0, the supported cipher suites 
are:
     TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.0 ciphers:
     * TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA (secp384r1)
     * TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA (secp384r1)
     * TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA (rsa 2048)
     * TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA (rsa 2048)
 
     TLSv1.2 ciphers:
     * TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 (secp384r1)
     * TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 (secp384r1)
     * TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256 (secp384r1)
     * TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384 (secp384r1)
     * TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA (secp384r1)
     * TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA (secp384r1)
     * TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 (rsa 2048)
     * TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 (rsa 2048)
     * TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA (rsa 2048)
     * TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA (rsa 2048)

As an aside, this behaviour occurs with dbmlsync 17 build 7208  and newer, in my experimentation.  Adding the min_tls_version=1.1 resolves that in my testing.  I assume that will also be true in your usage. This can also be avoided using MobiLink 17 server.

entry.title: Re: Bank Account derivation from IBAN via API Business Pa...
entry.content:
Hello @Erika_Renna 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Business Partner (A2X) – OData API, Maintaining Bank Statement Data, Business Partner Replication

To summarise, in public cloud, the Business Partner (A2X) API enforces the same validation rules as the Fiori or backend UI. This means, when you create or update a BP record with bank details, the system requires the following fields: Bank Country, Bank Key, Bank Account and Account Control Key (may be country-specific). Providing only the IBAN is not sufficient because SAP’s data model for the BP Bank Details entity expects all related attributes to be present at the time you create it.

In the public cloud version of the API, automatic derivation of bank key or account details from the IBAN is currently not supported. This is due to its adherence to the clean-core principle.

A clean-core approach I recommend is to derive your bank fields externally before calling SAP. That means, let your external system perform IBAN parsing and derive the corresponding Bank Country, bank Key, and Account Number. You can do this by using public IBAN directory logic or lightweight middleware step before sending data to the API.

Below are steps for the recommendation.

Search for Manage Bank Data

Search for your respective bank using IBAN (screenshot uses Deutschebank)

Open Maintain Business Partner --> try creating a BP with only the IBAN field --> the system will block you from saving due to missing Bank Country/Key.

Test API_BUSINESS_PARTNER endpoint in Communication Arrangement SAP_COM_0008. Submit a payload with IBAN only --> then observe the error the system provides.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Goods movement issue
entry.content:
Hello @PlamenTraychev 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Goods Movement Document, Material Movements for Confirmation, Units of Measure

In summary, the public cloud system allows financial quantities in goods movements if the material’s UOM is configured to accept decimals in MM. So, that behaviour is technically correct and not a system error.

In your example where you post a movement for 5.3 pcs, this is possible if the piece unit in your system is maintained with 3 decimal places in the UOM.

The public cloud restricts due to its clean-core approach fractional quantities are not supported. By adhering to the clean-core principle, you can control that behaviour by using configuration and master data control.

Below is a clean-core approach you may follow:

Search for Product Master Data

Select the material in question --> go to Units of Measure --> Ensure your Base UoM is correctly maintained as PC with 0 decimals --> Save and verify through Manage Material movements app. System should round or reject decimal entries.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP集成套件中的Cloud Integration云集成功能概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

Cloud Integration云集成是什么？

是SAP集成套件的核心组成部分，云集成这块功能扮演着核心执行引擎的角色，负责实际的消息处理和数据传输工作，确保信息在不同系统间安全高效地流动 。

 

 

SAP开发云集成功能的目的是什么？

解决现代企业面临的混合IT环境挑战。随着企业同时使用云应用和本地系统，如何让这些异构系统无缝协作。

它与SAP集成套件的其他功能协同工作，如Integration Advisor提供B2B集成场景中的字段映射建议，Trading Partner Management 管理需要集成的大量业务伙伴，API Management提供安全的API访问，形成完整的集成解决方案 。

 

 

云集成可以用来干什么？

云集成就像企业的"数字神经网络"，实际连接各个业务系统，以最简单的从A系统同步消息到B系统的场景举例：

1.接口对接：

云集成支持所有主流接口，无论A/B系统使用的是常见的HTTP/Odata协议，还是SAP专用的RFC协议，云集成都能对接上，也就是说A或B系统可以均为非SAP系统；

云集成还内置连接器，集成特定应用时可以节约工作量（A或B为特定应用时）;

针对特定的集成场景（A,B，集成场景均特定时）提供开箱即用的预定义内容，填写系统网址即可部署

2. 低代码开发的消息内容修改，格式转换：

在从A获取到数据，发送至B之前，云集成支持以低代码的方式开发数据加工流程，只需要拖拉拽所需工件，组成流程，就可以将从A获取的数据进行一系列按顺序的修改，例如从XML转换为JSON；加密/解密；从S/4HANA格式映射为其他应用格式。除了基本的顺序处理之外，还支持逻辑路由、分割器等高级消息处理功能。

3.监控

开发完成的集成流在部署，执行工作之后，会产生日志记录，会展现从A接收到消息/处理消息/将消息发送给B过程中每一步处理的结果，并且在遇到报错时高亮报错的具体点位

 

 

云集成功能与市面上类似功能有什么区别？

1. 丰富的预构建集成内容

SAP提供大量现成的集成流、API和连接器，特别是针对SAP产品的深度集成内容。这就像拥有一个专业的"集成模板库"，大部分常见场景都有现成的解决方案，而不需要从零开始开发。

2. 基于BTP的平台优势

作为SAP业务技术平台的原生服务，云集成功能享受平台级的安全、监控和治理能力。这就像住在一个配套完善的智能社区，所有基础设施都是现成的，都不需要自己搭建。

3. 与SAP生态的完美结合

  • 深度集成：与SAP S/4HANA、SuccessFactors等SAP产品无缝集成
  • 统一体验：共享SAP的设计语言和操作习惯
  • 自动更新：SAP负责预构建内容的维护和更新

相比其他集成平台需要大量定制开发，SAP云集成功能提供了"开箱即用"的SAP生态集成能力，特别适合以SAP为核心的企业IT环境。

 

 

云集成功能该怎么用呢？

使用云集成功能就像搭建企业的"数字高速公路"，主要步骤包括：

1. 获取，并配置环境，分配权限

2. 设计集成流程

  • 使用可视化的集成流编辑器设计消息处理流程
  • 利用BPMN图形化建模方式，拖拽组件构建集成逻辑

3. 配置接口，以及数据的转换过程

  • 选择合适的适配器连接发送方和接收方系统
  • 配置消息转换、路由和安全设置

4. 部署和监控

  • 将集成流部署到运行时环境
  • 使用内置监控仪表板跟踪消息流和性能

整个过程采用低代码方式，通过图形化界面就能完成复杂的集成设计，大大降低了技术门槛

 

 

 

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法，如果时间紧迫，也可以直接联系到我 arthuryang1996@foxmail.com，感谢你的时间

entry.title: Re: EDI Order import Failed due to 3 or more decimal point
entry.content:
Oof, that's an old (and quite infuriating) SAP error. I've encountered that one previously.

Those error messages, especially `Number of decimal places exceeds maximum allowed`, are telling you the whole story.

SAP is quite specific regarding the format of data, especially in the case of money. For almost all normal currencies (like USD, EUR, etc.), SAP is designed to only accept two decimal places for any "Amount" or value field.

Your setup is trying to send `0.738800`, which is four digits after the decimal (the trailing zeros don't count, it's `0.7388`). The default API sees that, compares it to the two-decimal policy for its internal currency style, and says "I don't know how to convert this." And the whole operation then breaks.

 How to Fix It

You have a few options, but the first one is the most likely candidate for this specific value type.

 

  1. Is this a "Price Per X" Unit? (Most Likely Solution)

 

This is a pretty common scenario in Sales & Distribution (SD). Are you trying to ship a price like "$0.7388 per 1 piece"?

 

If that is the case, SAP does not facilitate this using four decimal places. Instead, it uses a pricing unit.

 

 Wrong Way: Price = `0.7388`, Pricing Unit = `1`

 SAP Way: Price = `73.88`, Pricing Unit = `100`

 

In the IDoc (assuming an `ORDERS05` or similar), you'd put this in the conditions segment (e.g., `E1EDP05`). You would need to make sure that you're populating the fields correctly:

 Condition Amount (`KBETR`): `73.88`

 Pricing Unit (`KPEIN`): `100`

 Unit of Measure (`KMEIN`): `PC` (or whatever your UoM is)

 

The system delivering the data needs to perform the conversion before building the IDoc.

 

  1. Fix it in the Source System (The "Clean" Fix)

 

If it's not a pricing unit case and is merely a total value, the cleanest thing to do is to round the value down to two decimal places in the source system before  sending it over to SAP.

 

Thus, `0.738800` must be rounded to `0.74` and it should be sent in such a way. This ensures all data going into SAP has already followed the rules.

 

  1. Fix it in the Middleware (The "Middle" Fix)

 

If you cannot update the source system, you can normally fix this in your mapping layer (e.g., SAP PI/PO, CPI, MuleSoft, BizTalk, etc.). Whatever software that is converting the source file into the IDoc, you can program a rule in the mapping to automatically round that specific amount field to two decimal places.

What NOT to do:

Don't try to alter the SAP currency configuration (transaction `OY04` or `TCURX`) to accommodate four decimal places. While it might sound like an answer, it will have gigantic, system-wide side effects and destroy countless standard reports, transactions, and calculations.

My money's on 1 ! the price unit. It's the most common reason for 3+ decimals in an SD integration. 

Hope that helps you get it sorted out!

entry.title: How Contractual delivery date for ADHOC line gets determined in sales order in SAP
Master Logistics Series :Outbound Logistics with SAP Logistics Management-Direct LTL Variant
entry.content:
In this scenario, you’ll see how SAP Logistics Management intelligently groups multiple deliveries into a single shipment up to a predefined cutoff time. The system then determines the most suitable carrier using built-in determination rules or through the SAP Business Network For Logistics (BN4L)-integrated freight tendering process. Once the carrier is confirmed, warehouse activities such as picking, packing, and staging are initiated, enabling a smooth and efficient transition from order processing to physical dispatch.

SAP Logistics Management Home screen

 

we will see the Direct LTL variant which is a specialized Less-Than-Truckload (LTL) shipping model in which the carrier moves freight directly to its destination without further transshipments.

In this example, an outbound delivery is created in SAP S/4 HANA to be shipped from a warehouse that is managed by SAP Logistics Management.  

In SAP Logistics Management, predefined processing variants determine how transportation and warehousing processes are executed. When using the Incoterms EXW (Ex Works) or FCA (Free Carrier), the system automatically assigns the No_Shipping processing variant.

In this example, for the Direct_LTL process — which is transportation relevant — an outbound delivery is created with Incoterm DAP (Delivered at Place) for a ship-to party in the U.S.

Outbound delivery created in S/4 HANA ERP distributed to Logistics Management

 When the delivery is saved, it is automatically distributed to the SAP Logistics Management system by means of an integration task, initiating the transportation and warehousing processes.

Deliveries relevant for Transportation planning will have the Transportation request created automatically in SAP Logistics Management.

With Manage Transportation Requests  app ,Logistics clerk can start and monitor the transportation planning. It contains the transportation-relevant product items as well as detailed information, for example, about the requested shipping dates, your business partner, and the number of product items in your order.

Transportation Request with Progress overview

 Transportation request further shows the progress overview of the shipment status and the number of estimated Handling units to be shipped.

From each document in SAP Logistics Management, navigation to the related documents is possible

Related documents in the Transportation Request

A consignment is a groupage of Transportation requests. Various Transportation requests with same shipping criteria are automatically consolidated into a consignment, until the cutoff time is reached.

 In this processing variant, the consignment is automatically created, and transportation requests are automatically assigned to it.

After the consolidation cutoff time the system automatically closes the consolidation and no additional transportation requests can be assigned.

Alternatively, you can complete the consolidation manually after grouping the required transportation requests.

List of transportation requests grouped in the consignment

 After the consolidation completion, the carrier determination process starts automatically. In this example, the carrier determination process is- In Tendering.

With Manage Consignments app ,we can Monitor the progress of the transportation planning regarding consolidation, carrier determination, and subcontracting

Carrier determination progress overview in Manage consignments app

 When we navigate to the Request for Quotation (RFQ) document from the consignment, we see the carrier is listed for publishing the RFQ. Potential Carriers are added based on the pre defined template in Manage Freight Tendering Template app.

Manage Freight Tendering app

 Manage Freight Tendering app is used to optimize the freight tendering process by publishing tenders, sending RFQs to carriers, finalizing the received quotations, and award the selected carrier for transport.

Once the details are verified, the RFQ is published and status is changed to “Awaiting response from Carrier”

Tendering Life cycle status in Manage Tendering app

BN4L Freight collaboration Integration:

SAP Logistics management is integrated with SAP Business Network Freight Collaboration  for seamless collaboration with carriers .

Carrier receives the RFQ  in Freight Requests for Quotation app

Open RFQs in Freight Requests for Quotation app in BN4L Freight Collaboration

 Carrier proposes the price and accepts the RFQ

Once the carrier accepts, this is reflected seamlessly in SAP Logistics Management  with the quote received from Carrier notification .

Home screen with tendering notification

 We can also use Joule to show the tenders to be awarded. This will be very easy for the Logistics Clerk to retrieve all the tenders that need to be awarded.

   

With the prompt “Show tenders waiting to be awarded,” we get the consignments that have carrier responses and are ready to be awarded.

 From the joule chat window, we navigate to the details of the consignment  that is to be awarded

 When the proposed offer is finalized, Logistics Clerk awards the Quotation 

Awarding Quotation from Manage Consignment app

 The consignment is sent to Carrier and confirmation from the carrier is updated.

With the Transportation steps completed, the deliveries are ready for warehouse processing.  With this, the outbound warehouse request is created which is the execution document within SAP Logistics Management for the warehouse activities.

From the app “Manage Outbound Warehouse Activities”, picking tasks are created .

We see the Pick task is created to move the Product from the source bin to the Goods Issue area (note: in this example, packing will be done at the GI-Area).

Plan Picking -Automatic warehouse task creation

 

Picking task is created using the automatic task creation option, and stock is allocated from the fixed bin.

We will now execute the picking task with SAP Warehouse Logistics mobile app.

 

 

Destination Bin is scanned and picking task is completed

 

The picking task is executed, and the product is located at the GI-Area, ready for packaging in the pack work center

Handling Unit Creation in Pack Work Center

In the packing work center app, the shipping Handling Unit is created and the product is packed .

Label Printing is triggered from Pack Work Center

 

Label is printed for the packed Handling Unit.

All warehouse requests are packed and staging is completed.

Progress overview of warehouse activities

 In the Manage Pickups and Deliveries app, we see the Pickup/Delivery document. Pick up document is automatically created to plan and track the pickup. Pickup/delivery document provides all necessary information to handle, organize, and track the transportation activities for a truck 

Check in logged for the incoming truck with necessary information.

Progress overview is updated with arrival status. Once all the Handling units are loaded, the complete loading status is updated .

Pickup progress overviewTruck check out is recorded to update the departure.

 

In the Manage Outbound Warehouse activities app, warehouse request is selected and Goods Issue is posted.

Progress Overview showing all activities are completed

 

The Goods issue posting is reflected in SAP S/4HANA for outbound deliveries .

By automating and integrating every stage of the logistics process — from delivery consolidation to carrier selection and warehouse execution — SAP Logistics Management delivers greater visibility, efficiency, and control across the supply chain. This intelligent approach not only reduces manual effort and operational costs but also ensures on-time, accurate deliveries. Ultimately, SAP Logistics Management empowers businesses to streamline logistics operations, enhance customer satisfaction, and drive smarter, data-driven decision-making in transportation management[.

SAP Logistics Management SAP Business Network for Logistics Joule SAP Extended Warehouse Management SAP Transportation Management

entry.title: Enabling Embedded SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) for Seamless Business Insights
entry.content:
Embedded SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) is a streamlined version of the full SAP Analytics Cloud platform, included at no extra cost with most SAP products. Once configured in SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 or SAP Enterprise Service Management, this embedded solution allows users to access analytics directly within these applications, helping to drive better decision-making without the learning curve associated with custom/multiple in-built analytics solutions.

While Embedded SAC is designed for ease of use, it does require a one-time configuration to integrate with your SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 or SAP Enterprise Service Management solutions. Additionally, to enable a smooth login experience for your users, integration with an Identity Provider (IdP) is necessary.

Integration with Identity Providers (IdP)

For secure and streamlined access, you can choose from two supported Identity Providers:

  • SAP Cloud Platform Identity Authentication Service (SAP IAS)
  • Microsoft Entra ID

These IdPs help ensure that users can easily log in to Embedded SAC with their existing credentials. Detailed configuration steps for for these can be found in our comprehensive documentation : https://help.sap.com/docs/CX_NG_SALES/ea5ff8b9460a43cb8765a3c07d3421fe/eceac5a75db64ddbb7afd524058a0a0c.html

For a step-by-step guide on how to enable Embedded SAC and configure it with SAP IAS, we’ve created an instructional video, which you can access here : https://sapvideo.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com/?entry_id=1_3w0xwam0

Troubleshooting & FAQs

If you encounter any issues during the setup process, our online help documentation provides a range of FAQs to assist you. We recommend reviewing these before reaching out for additional support : https://help.sap.com/docs/CX_NG_SALES/ea5ff8b9460a43cb8765a3c07d3421fe/319683f2e2b24f8a94eda0fbe9f74271.html

Conclusion:

By embedding SAP Analytics Cloud into your SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 or SAP Enterprise Service Management environment, you unlock deeper, actionable insights, all while streamlining the user experience. Get started today by configuring Embedded SAC and integrating with your chosen Identity Provider.

entry.title: Activate Joule in SAP Concur - a Step-by-Step Guide
entry.content:
We are here with yet another release of the Joule service. You will now be able to use your SAP Concur system with Joule and have conversations naturally with your Concur system. Joule in SAP Concur can help you manage your expense-related activities, such as creating reports, editing expense reports, creating attendees, viewing expense Details, and many more.

With this release, we are also happy to introduce you to the SAP Concur Booking Agent, which will be generally available to all our SAP Concur customers. The Agent will enable users to search for and book flights directly.

In this blog, we will examine the step-by-step details of activating Joule with your SAP Concur system. We have also added some basic information, as some of our customers may be SAP Concur-only customers. We recommend reading the details below before you get started. To make this a simpler process, let us examine the process flow for activating Joule in your tenant.

Image 1

 

First, I would like to introduce you to the commercial aspect of getting the required license. As an SAP Concur customer, you can opt for the SAP Joule BASE SKU, which is a “0$” contract with options ranging from 1 year to 3 years. To sign up for this, you can visit the link here and follow the onscreen instructions. In case of any questions, please feel free to contact your SAP AE or the CSM.  During the contract process, you will be asked to select an SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) tenant where Joule needs to be contracted. If you are an SAP Concur-only customer and do not have an SAP BTP account, please select New BTP Account and proceed further.

Important Tips: (Please ensure to read them before you work on the license):

  • If you are an SAP Concur-only customer, without an SAP footprint
    • You may have to register yourself first, follow the onscreen instructions in the SAP Store – Buy as a customer. Refer to this document for more information - Joule Base Entitlement
    • If you are an and do not have a BTP Account, it will be provisioned free of cost along with Joule
    • Provisioning of new BTP Accounts and Joule contracts may take less than 24 hours, at times up to 48 hours.
    • If you are new to SAP BTP and would like to get familiar, you can request a session here
    • If you have an existing SAP BTP account, we recommend using the existing accounts and avoiding creating a new one
    • Joule requires SAP Cloud Identity Services (SAP CIS)
      • You can configure your SSO with SAP Concur with SAP CIS as IDP, or
      • You can configure your SSO with SAP Concur with SAP CIS as a proxy. In case you have an existing IDP, like MS Azure/OKTA, you can continue using it; however, you need to replicate the users in your SAP CIS. You can find more details as you read below
      • SAP Concur gives you the option to have multiple SSOs. In case you would like to try with a few users to log in via SAP CIS, you can do so. This ensures that you do not change the entire setup or impact all the users during the testing process
    • If you do not have SAP Cloud Identity Services as a Concur-Only customer, you can activate up to 2 tenants (test/prod) from your SAP BTP Account free of cost. For more information, refer to the Discovery Center Mission here. 
    • In case you are not sure of the available SAP Cloud Identity Services for you, please validate -
  • Joule contracts can only be sold once to a customer. If you have the Joule Base or SAP AI Units contracts, you do not have to sign new contracts, and you are good to go ahead with the setup of Joule with SAP Concur

 

Second, once the Contract is signed, you will need to create an Incident and share your SAP Concur – “Entity ID” and “SAP - Customer Number” (in case you need support, please contact your AE or your CSM), the required “SAP Cloud Identity Service Tenant” for SAP Concur Integration.

Important Tip:

  • If you are new to SAP, you can find information on how to create SAP incidents here,  to create an SAP for Me case, see this SAP Note: 1296527 Information published on the SAP site—How to create a support case (contact SAP Product Support)—SAP for Me. Use the Component = BNS-CON-SSO.
    • For more information about creating an SAP Concur support case, navigate to the SAP Concur Support Portal and select Case Type = Single Sign On.

    •  

      Joule can be activated with your SAP Concur Sandbox / Production systems. Please ensure to raise the tickets based on your point of start to achieve SSO.
  • If you are an SAP Concur-only customer,
    • When you sign the new contract, a new CRM ID will be generated with an SAP BTP account

 

Third, once the Incident is addressed and processed, you will receive instructions from SAP on how to case you use MS Entra / OKTA / any other IDP services. Please ensure you have the user’s sync (replicate the users) from your IDP to SAP CIS and have completed all the steps mentioned in the above image before you start the Joule integration process.

Please check the * conditions mentioned in the Image above. Some of the processes have been detailed below to ensure you can plan the User Sync with SAP Cloud Identity Services and your IDP.

Important Tip:

  • Overview of SAP Cloud Identity Services
  • Here is the help portal link step-by-step guide: Concur SSO - Identity Authentication Service for SAP Cloud Identity Services Setup. Ensure to complete Step 1 and Step 2 of this help page.
  • The SAP Concur Import & Export admin role should be able to follow the help portal document 315 (SAP Global User ID Importer) for the employee file upload. For more information, refer to Step 2 of this blog

 

Fourth, once you complete the above-mentioned prerequisites, we recommend that you plan the Joule setup from the SAP Help Portal or the details below.

 

 

Let us have a look at the steps involved for the integration:

1. SAP Concur SSO with SAP Cloud Identity Services

2. Global User ID (GUID) - User Mapping in SAP Concur

3. Joule Integration

  • Scenario 1: Joule in SAP Concur - new setup
  • Scenario 2: You have an existing Joule setup, and a formation has been created

Image 2

4. Post-integration checks

5. Joule test scenarios

6. SAP Concur Booking Agent

Now that we have a process in place, we are ready to get started:

 

1. SAP Concur SSO with SAP Cloud Identity Services

Ensure your SAP Concur users are able to log in via the SAP Cloud Identity Services. (The details have been covered in the process above.)

2. Global User ID (GUID) - User Mapping in SAP Concur

The SAP Global User ID is a unique value identifier across the SAP Landscape, and this unique value is generated from the SAP Cloud Identity Services by default when a user is created. This GUID is required to be the same in your SAP Concur System for Joule to be operational for the users. In this step, we will see how to replicate the GUID from your SAP CIS to the SAP Concur system.

Note:

  • For more information on GUID and how to manage it, see the link here.
  • If you are using MS Entra Object ID and wish to continue as a GUID, you may refer to this link for the setup.

In the current release, we do this manually by copying the GUID from SAP Cloud Identity Services to SAP Concur, but the SAP product teams will soon automate this process. Let’s take a look at how to achieve this manually.

To begin, you will need the “Import/Extract Monitor" role in the SAP Concur system. Once you have this role, you can download the sample file attached to this blog post, which is in “UTF-8 format” as shown below.

 

Image 3

We will edit the following values. In our case, we are using the Employee ID from SAP Concur, which is a common ID used in other applications.

 

Image 4

You can follow the User export from the IAS process to get the SAP Global ID and create a flat file according to the SAP Concur 315 record type for the SAP Global ID Importer.

Note that row 1 with the value “100” is mandatory; do not modify or edit this line. Row 2 shows the required values, and row 3 gives you the samples. In most cases, it's our understanding that Concur customers are aware of this flat file process, and you can find the details of this process here: 315 (SAP Global User ID Importer).

Once the file is ready with user details to import the GUID (recommend testing it with a few users and then adding more), you can log in to your SAP Concur system and navigate to Home  -> click on Tools -> and click on Import/Export Monitor -> click on the option Import, and click on “Upload”, select the file that you have created.

The monitor page is only available for users with the "Import/Extract Monitor" role.

Image 5

Once you have the file uploaded, look for the option “EMPLOYEE_” and click on "Run Now". In case you do not see this option to “Run Now”, you may have to wait for the daily schedule. Once completed, you should be able to see the Success message of the Last Run Status.

 

 

Image 6

Note: We do not have an option to validate this in the Concur system if the GUID is mapped to the users. However, you can check with API Access, and you may need the Concur web service license to check the GUID API access. Create a ticket in case we need to validate the GUID.

 

3. Integrating Joule

Scenario 1: Joule in SAP Concur - new setup

As mentioned above, for the new Joule setup in SAP Concur, you can follow the steps below.

You can follow the steps in this blog - Joule Setup – End-to-End Setup Guide (for all Line of Business) Unified Approach.

Note: Joule with SAP Concur does not use SAP Build Work Zone services as of this release.

Only skip the following steps:

 

3. Registering an SAP System – token exchange
3a. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition – Maintain Extensions on SAP BTP
3b. SAP SuccessFactors - Extension Center
3c. Validate your System Registration in SAP BTP

 

9. Activate the SAP Build Work Zone - Subscriptions and Instances (foundation or standard plan)

  1. Create the Service Key
  2. Assign Role Collection
  3. Enable Identity Authentication
  4. Validate the System Formation

13. Create Navigation Service Destination (has been deprecated)

Follow all the steps apart from the ones listed above and focus on the steps below:

Check if your SAP Concur system is listed in the SAP BTP in the Systems section.

 

 

Image 7

Next, during the Joule Booster (an automated integration process), ensure that you select the SAP Concur system (Image 43, Image 44, and Image 45). As mentioned in the blog post above, you should be able to see the Joule formation in Ready status.

This completes the setup process, and you should now be able to see the Joule icon in your SAP Concur tenant. However, we recommend following the steps Post Booster Validation below.

In case of a standalone setup of Joule with SAP Concur, you should be able to see the formation as below:

 

Image 8

Scenario 2: You have an existing Joule setup, and a formation has been created

In this section, we will show you how to activate Joule in SAP Concur in the context of an existing Joule formation.

To integrate your system, you can navigate to your SAP BTP Formations, look for the existing formation, and click on Include system.

Note:

  • Please ensure you have the same SAP Cloud Identity Services used for your Unified Setup, as shown in the image below, and that the prerequisites are completed

If you are using the SAP Concur sandbox/test system for initial setup with other SAP LoB Applications,  we understand that the users may be appended with “xxx@xx.uat” in your SAP Concur for Login. Please ensure you are using a common email address in all your non-prod systems, which can be authenticated by SAP IAS and can help you achieve a unified Joule experience

 

Image 9

If you have a large list of systems, you can filter it by SAP Concur, select the system you would like to integrate with Joule, and click on Next Step.

Image 10

Select both the options listed “Enable Capability Deployment” and “Enable the Joule Icon in the Integrated System” click on Review. This will deploy the concur scenarios and also activate the Joule icon in the system.

 

Image 11

Please review the selections and click on Include.

Image 12

The setup should normally take 5-8 minutes. You should be able to see a processing message and then finally enter a ready state, as shown below.

 

Image 13

This confirms that the setup has been completed, and you should be able to see the Joule icon in your system. Please ensure you complete the next steps before you access Joule.

 

4. Post Integration Checks

4.1 Validate Application List

Upon Joule integration, multiple background activities run to make the integration successful. You can navigate to your SAP Cloud Identity Services to check if the following Applications are created.

Image 14

4.2 Trusted Domains

We will add the SAP Concur systems to the Trusted Domain. To do this, click on Application & Resources -> select Tenant Settings -> select Customization -> click on Trusted Domain, click on Add, enter your SAP Concur URL, and click on Save.

In case of Sandbox/Test System setup, please check your SAP Concur tenant URL and add it accordingly. E.g.  implementation.concursolutions.com.

Image 15

Similar settings should be maintained in your SAP BTP Subaccount. Expand the Security option, click on Settings, and add the SAP Concur domain, as shown below.

 

 

Image 16

4.3 SAP Concur Destination in your SAP BTP Subaccount

You should also be able to see a Concur SSO destination in your SAP BTP Subaccount, as shown below.

Image 17

This completes the setup of Joule with your SAP Concur system.

 

5. Joule Test Scenarios with SAP Concur 

You can now log in to your SAP Concur system, and you should be able to see the Joule icon, click on it to launch the Joule client as shown below.

Image 18

You can find all the Joule use cases with SAP Concur – Transactional Use Cases and Informational Use Cases.

 

6. SAP Concur Booking Agent

This service allows users to search for flights, select the required flight, review the booking, and confirm it. The images below provide some details about how it works.

You can start the conversation with a question, either “Book a flight” or “Search a flight,” with the details that you need.

 

 

Image 19

I continue to provide the requested details and the preferred time of my flight.

 

Image 20

I can also ask for alternative flights/airlines.

Image 21

 

Based on the information, you can validate the time and confirm the flight from Joule.

Image 22

You can look at the details on how this works using the link – Reserve flights using Joule.

Credit to the SAP Concur Team for supporting this blog post.

Stay tuned for more updates!!! Happy Learning for now!!!

Regards,
Nagesh Caparthy
SAP Business AI RIG Team

entry.title: Re: Marketplace App UX Design Guidelines for SAP Users
entry.content: Designing Marketplace apps for SAP requires balancing usability with SAP’s structured, data-heavy environment. Following SAP Fiori design principles provides a solid foundation for consistency, navigation, and layout, but it’s best to adapt them to suit specific workflows and simplify interactions. SAP users prioritize clarity, efficiency, and workflow continuity over aesthetics, so keeping interfaces intuitive, data well-organized, and actions contextual is key. Avoid cluttered dashboards, inconsistent terminology, or modal-heavy navigation, and focus on performance, accessibility, and seamless integration with SAP’s native experience. Ultimately, a well-designed SAP-integrated app should feel like a natural extension of the platform — boosting productivity without overwhelming the user.

entry.title: SAP业务数据云中的SAP Analytics Cloud分析云概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

 

SAP Analytics Cloud是什么？

SAP Analytics Cloud分析云是SAP业务数据云(Business Data Cloud, 即BDC)的核心分析组件，扮演着企业"数据大脑"的角色。它将BI、预测和Planning功能统一在一个云平台中，就像为企业配备了一位既能看懂历史、又能预测未来、还能制定计划的智能顾问。

 

 

SAP开发分析云的目的是什么？

解决企业面临的决策滞后挑战。传统企业的数据只能以原始数据的方式呈现，管理者难以获得全局视角进行快速决策，但借助BDC中的分析云功能就可以通过丰富的图表来更直观的了解企业的量化现状，了解过去，甚至是预测未来

 

 

Analytics Cloud可以用来干什么？

Analytics Cloud就像企业的"智能决策中心"，提供三大核心能力：

1. BI分析

自助式报表创建：业务用户可以像制作PPT一样拖拽创建专业的数据可视化界面

移动端访问：高管在出差途中也能通过手机查看关键业务指标

2. 预测分析

智能预测：基于历史销售数据预测下季度收入趋势

异常检测：自动识别费用支出中的异常模式

机器学习集成：无需数据科学背景即可应用AI算法

3. 企业计划

协作式预算编制：各部门可以同时在线编制和调整预算计划

情景模拟：快速模拟"如果销量增长20%"对整体业绩的影响

版本管理：自动跟踪预算修改历史和审批流程

 

 

Analytics Cloud和市面上常见分析工具有什么区别？

1. 三合一集成能力

传统方案需要分别购买BI工具、预测软件和规划系统，Analytics Cloud将三者统一，就像买了一台既能打电话、又能上网、还能拍照的智能手机，而不是分别买三个设备。

2. 平台优势

享受BTP技术平台企业级的安全、合规和治理能力，数据处理符合GDPR等法规要求，就像住在有专业物业管理的高端社区，安全和服务都有保障；同时原生和BDC内的其他数据集成，数据存储，数据建模工具集成，可以一站式的解决所有数据需求

3. 与SAP生态的完美结合

原生集成：与SAP系统通过配置即可连接，数据实时同步

统一体验：延续SAP Fiori设计风格，用户学习成本低

内容丰富：提供行业最佳实践模板和预构建分析内容

 

 

Analytics Cloud该怎么用呢？

使用Analytics Cloud就像为企业搭建"智能驾驶舱"，主要步骤包括：

1. 环境准备，账户权限配置，数据集成

2. 数据建模，KPI指标设计

3. 创建分析内容，低代码拖拉拽即可生成报表内容

4. 协作和分享，在企业内分享内容，获取反馈

 

 

 

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法，如果时间紧迫，也可以直接联系到我 arthuryang1996@foxmail.com，感谢你的时间

entry.title: Extend in Flexible Item Category Determination
entry.content:
Business Overview

What's New in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1, you can create custom fields from customer material master and use them as business conditions in the flexible item category determination for sales quotations, sales orders, and sales orders without charge.

Prerequisite

1. APP: Custom Field, create custom field, choose business context: Sales: Customer Material.

Enabled all user interfaces and Business Scenarios

Publish the custom field, the system automatically creates a field with business context Sales: Sales Document Item.

2. Edit the custom field of Business Context Sales: Sales Document Item

Enable the data source I_SlsDocItmCatDetnItmCstmParam and C_SALESORDERMANAGE_SD

And relevant business scenario

3. Configuration Create BRFplus Objects for Sales Document Categories (SSCUI: 106584)

Choose the ITEM_CATEGORY_DETERMIATION Custom Adaptation, Copy the template, and then click Update BRFplus Objects

Click Simplified BRFplus Workbench, check the custom field exist.

Business Example: Specific customer materials are designated as free processes

Edit the decision table columns：

Set the custom field - customermaterial: Free; Item Category: CBXN

Note:

  • Field Sales Doc. Type; Item Cat. Group; Item Usage; ItemCat-HgLvltm is set mandatory. 
  • You need follow the table of SSCUI: Assign item categories .
  • You could set "is initial" as blank for the field.

4. APP: Manage Customer Materials，create the customer material

System Behavior

APP: Create Sales Order - VA01, input the customer, material, customer material and quantity, the item category will auto determinate as CBXN.

Many thanks

entry.title: How to Return Redundant Input Product Back to Original Logistics Area
entry.content:
In production, supplied input products may not been consumed completely, how to return these redundant input products back to original logistics area?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to Return Redundant Input Product Back to Origina...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

There are two ways to achieve this:

  1. Open the supply task, under tab Line Items, confirm the quantity for the redundant input product that should be returned but with negative. For example, if 1 ea of input product ABC (ABC represents product ID) should be returned back to original logistics area, then maintain -1 ea as Actual Quantity for input product ABC, click Save. 
  2. Go to work center Internal Logistics, open common task New Removal, find corresponding input product in corresponding production logistics area, create a new removal.

Henry

SAP Support

entry.title: Accessing On-Premises HTTP APIs with SAP Joule Studio and SAP Cloud Connector
entry.content:
SAP Joule Studio enables you to design and build intelligent AI agents and skills that automate and optimize your business processes. To ensure these agents can operate effectively, it is essential to allow them to read from and write data to third-party systems using APIs. In a typical SAP landscape, some of these systems may reside on-premises. To securely access such on-premises systems, the SAP Cloud Connector is the recommended approach. This blog post will guide you through the process of setting up and connecting a Joule skill or agent project in SAP Joule Studio to integrate securely through the Cloud Connector.

The scenario is as follows: We have SAP Joule Studio running on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), while the On-Premises systems exposes its endpoints. To establish a secure connection, we will configure the Cloud Connector, create a destination, set up a SAP Build Actions Project and use that Action in a Joule skill.

Let's dive into the steps required to set up this integration and leverage the power of SAP Joule Studio in conjunction with the SAP Cloud Connector.

Prerequisite


Before proceeding with the steps outlined in this guide, it is essential to have an instance of the SAP Cloud Connector installed. While it is possible to install the Cloud Connector on a server, for the purposes of this demonstration, we will be using a Windows machine. We recommend following the instructions provided in this blog (https://blogs.sap.com/2021/09/05/installation-and-configuration-of-sap-cloud-connector/) to install and configure the Cloud Connector until the Subaccount is connected.

Second requirement is a BTP subaccount with a SAP Build Process Automation (Joule Studio) instance. To this subaccount we will connect the Cloud Connector.

1. Cloud Connector Configuration


The first step is to create a configuration in the Cloud Connector that connects to our subaccount and exposes the HTTP resource. For the purpose of this demonstration, I ran a small Node.js server on my Windows machine that outputs “Hello World”.

To create the configuration, navigate to the admin interface of the Cloud Connector. In here you need to select your registered Subaccount where your SAP Build Process Automation instance resides. Then create a “Cloud to On-Premise” configuration.

 

In the provided screenshot, you will notice that I have exposed the internal host "localhost" with port 3333 using a virtual host named "virtualhost". This virtual host will be used for making requests from the BTP side. Currently, I have configured an unrestricted access policy, allowing access to all paths. However, in production scenarios, it is recommended to define access policies with more granular control.

Please note that it is crucial to ensure that you have exposed the necessary resources in your configuration. This ensures that the required endpoints are accessible and allows for successful communication between the cloud and on-premises environments.

In this example, the system type is a Non-SAP System using the HTTP protocol. To confirm that the connection works, you can use the “Check availability of internal host” button. This step is essential, as it verifies the accuracy of your configuration and ensures successful connectivity between the cloud and your on-premises environment.

Note: It’s important to understand the difference between the internal and virtual host. The internal host refers to the hostname accessible within your on-premises network — in this case, it’s the localhost on my laptop. Later, within SAP BTP, we’ll reference the virtual host instead.

On the BTP Cockpit end, we can check the connected Cloud Connectors in the respective menu tab. If you cannot see this tab, you may be missing some roles. In the image, you see my registered Cloud Connector and the backend system with its virtualhost available.

2. Create Destination


After successfully registering the Cloud Connector, the next step is to create a destination. A destination serves as a means for services to access an API by handling the authentication and networking aspects.

By configuring a destination, you can simplify the process of accessing APIs by abstracting the underlying technical details. The destination takes care of handling authentication, network communication, and other necessary configurations, allowing services to focus on consuming the API and performing business logic without worrying about the underlying implementation.

Creating a destination provides a convenient way to encapsulate the necessary information, such as the API endpoint URL, authentication credentials, and other relevant settings. This abstraction helps streamline the integration process and facilitates secure and reliable communication between your services and the targeted API.

 

When creating the destination, there are several important details to specify. These include the name of the destination, the URL you want to access, and the type of destination. In this case, we will specify the URL as the virtual host "http://virtualhost:3333". To utilize the Cloud Connector, we set the Proxy Type to On-Premise.

Optionally one can also maintain the Authentication detail - my service does not require these.

Once the destination configuration is complete, it is crucial to use the "Check Connection" button to verify that everything is configured correctly and the connection can be established successfully. This step ensures that the destination is functioning as expected and is ready to be utilized in your automation processes. 

Note: Did you know? The Destination Service’s “Check Connection” behaves slightly differently when the destination is configured with the proxy type “OnPremise.”

For public APIs on the internet, the connection check typically validates both the authentication credentials and the specific path — in other words, it performs a real GET request on that endpoint.

In contrast, for on-premise HTTP destinations, the check is much simpler. It only performs an HTTP “ping” on the host to verify that some response is received. Even if the target system returns a 5xx error, the check will still show as successful as long as the Cloud Connector tunnel is reachable and the HTTP server responds.

Be aware that this behavior can have downstream effects when troubleshooting connectivity issues.

 

 

In the ideal case you get the green checkmark! But there are some common errors we need to discuss:

 

 

The "Backend not available" error occurs when the connectivity service is unable to locate the host you are trying to access. This could be due to the host not being exposed in the Cloud Connector configuration or a potential misspelling in the URL. To resolve this issue, it is important to revisit the URL and ensure that you are using the correct virtual host specified in the Cloud Connector configuration. Verify that the URL is accurate and matches the virtual host configuration to establish the necessary connectivity.

 

The second common issue that may arise is the "Resource not accessible" error. This occurs when the connectivity service successfully locates the backend you intend to connect to, but the specific resource (such as the subpath "/hello") either does not exist or is not allowed to be accessed based on the rules defined in the configuration. To resolve this, ensure that you have included the correct path in the Cloud Connector's resource configuration.

For the usage in SAP Build - there is one additional step to make the Destination available to be used inside the Build tool. We need to register the Destination in the Control Tower of SAP Build:

We can do so by navigating to SAP Build Control Tower > Destinations and then choose Add to add the Destination to our environments.

3. Create Actions Project

Now, let's dive into SAP Build Process Automation and create an Actions project. In this case, since my API is not a standard one, I will create a custom API Specification. However, if you are working with a target system like S/4HANA, you can leverage the pre-defined API Specifications available in the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

Let's give the Project a name of our choice and choose the option to "Upload API Specification".

SAP Build Actions allow us to upload OpenAPI Specifications in JSON format.

 

{
  "openapi": "3.0.0",
  "info": {
    "description": "Demonstration Hello World",
    "title": "helloworld",
    "version": "1.0.0"
  },
  "servers": [
    {
      "url": "empty"
    }
  ],
  "paths": {
    "/hello": {
      "get": {
        "summary": "get hello",
        "description": "get a hello world message",
        "operationId": "get.hello",
        "responses": {
          "200": {
            "description": "Successful response",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {
                  "type": "object",
                  "title": "Message Object",
                  "properties": {
                    "message": {
                      "type": "string"
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

The provided code snippet represents the API Specification, where I define the necessary details. In this case, the servers section is left empty as the URL will be retrieved from the destination configuration at a later stage. Additionally, I specify the available path as "/hello".

It's important to note that the path mentioned in the API specification will be preceded by the destination's URL. Therefore, in our scenario, the complete URL for the request will be "http://virtualhost:3333/hello".

Another crucial aspect for the functionality within the low-code environment is defining the expected response structure. In this case, the response payload will consist of a plain object with the key "message". To build and test specifications, you can utilize the website https://editor.swagger.io/. Be aware, that the response structure must match the specification; if, for example, fields are missing, you will be prompted with a schema error.

Once you have finalized the specification, save the file as a .json format and proceed to upload it to the Actions project.

Within the Actions Project, you will be prompted to add the desired actions, which you can proceed to do. Now, let's move on to testing:

Within the selected Action, navigate to the "Test" tab. Here, you have the option to select the destination that serves as the basis for the request. For this demonstration, I will choose the "sap-sample-api-via-cloud-connector" destination that I created earlier. Once the test is executed, you will find the response payload displayed at the bottom. In this particular case, the test is successful, and I receive the expected message from my On-Premises server.

If you encounter an error during the process, make sure to check the "View API" Section for any response body that might provide insights into the cause of the issue.

In the final step, we need to release and publish the Action to ensure its availability for consumption in an Project. To accomplish this, locate the buttons located at the top right-hand side of the Actions editor. Click on these buttons and ensure that the status indicates "released" and then "published."

4. Add Action to Joule Skill

Lets create a Project and include the Action in a Joule Skill. Do so by adding a step in the Skill with the + symbol.

First we need to add the Action Project in our dependencies:

We add a Action to the Skill, configure its Destination field by creating a new Destination Variable we give an arbitrary name.

We can see that the Action has the message variable in its output.

To prove that we can now also use the data from the API, I added an additional step to Send a Message with the API's result "message" variable in its content.

With the message editor - we can send a custom message to the user. In this case I keep it simple and just output the response from the message field of the API response.

 

After going through the standard deployment process in SAP Build Joule Studio - we can test our newly deployed skill directly in Joule.

And in this case we are successful and can retrieve the actual answer from the On-Premises HTTP System.

In the following posts we aim to provide further guidance on how to connect to a SAP On-Premises System - as this is the most common scenario for the extension of Joule. Take this blog post as the basis for understanding the concept and flow.

Hope you find this blog insightful, if you have any questions feel free to leave a comment.

entry.title: Re: Cost Price of item unexpectedly zero
entry.content:
Hi Johan,

 

Purchase Invoice functions in the same way as closing a Work order - it corrects the value of stock of that item. From what you attached you can see that it reduced the value of the remaining quantity (5 pcs) by the available value (3,85). I can only assume that the difference between posted value on the Goods Receipt and Invoice was equal or greater to 3,85, which caused the value of your remaining stock to be set to zero.

Inventory Audit Report is showing you quantites and values which were applied to a certain document. So you can see, the Purchase Invoice you mention has Quantity 0, and value 0,77. This means that remaining stock was valued at 0,77 for that transaction, and the negative in Trans. Value indicates that this amount was actually reduction of stock value at that point. Now, if you take a look at the journal entry of this Invoice, you will see what happened. In case the difference was greater than 3,85 value you had remaining, that should go to some offset account defined by your posting rules.

 

BR,

Matija

entry.title: SAP业务数据云中的Datasphere概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

Datasphere是什么？

SAP Datasphere是SAP业务数据云(Business Data Cloud,即BDC)的核心数据建模与数据集成组件，扮演着企业"数据中心"的角色。它将数据集成、数据建模、业务建模和数据治理功能统一在一个云平台中，负责连接、整合和建模来自SAP和非SAP系统的数据，确保数据在不同系统间安全高效地流动并保持业务语义。

 

 

SAP开发Datasphere的目的是什么？

解决现代企业面临的数据孤岛和混合IT环境挑战。如何让企业异构系统的数据无缝协作，同时保持SAP数据的业务语义，成为关键问题。

Datasphere与SAP BTP生态系统的其他功能协同工作：SAP HANA Cloud提供湖仓一体的数据存储能力，SAP Analytics Cloud实现数据消费与展现，与SAP Databricks相互调用模型/数据，并与S/4HANA等业务系统深度集成，形成完整的企业数据和分析解决方案。

 

 

Datasphere可以用来干什么？

Datasphere就像企业的"数据统一平台"，连接并保存各个业务系统的数据，以最典型的数据集成和建模场景举例：

1. 数据连接与集成

支持所有主流数据源连接，无论是SAP系统（S/4HANA、BW等）还是非SAP系统，都能无缝对接

内置预构建连接器，针对特定应用可以节约集成工作量

提供开箱即用的业务内容包，填写系统信息即可快速部署

2. 低代码数据建模和转换

支持图形化拖拽方式创建数据模型和转换流程，业务用户也能轻松操作

提供强大的SQL编辑器满足复杂建模需求

支持数据虚拟化、复制和转换等多种数据处理模式

3. 业务语义建模

保持SAP系统的业务语义和上下文，让数据更有意义

支持多维分析建模，内置数据预览功能

提供数据治理和目录功能，确保数据质量和可发现性

 

 

Datasphere和市面上常见的数据平台有什么区别？

1. 统一业务语义层的独特优势

这个平台结合BDC内各个组件，将数据集成、建模、治理和消费能力整合在一起。这就像拥有一个"数据管理的瑞士军刀"，而不需要购买多个独立的数据工具。

2. 基于BTP的平台优势

Datasphere享受BTP平台整体的安全、监控和治理能力。这就像住在一个配套完善的智能社区，所有基础设施都是现成的，无需自己搭建。

3. 与SAP生态的完美结合

深度集成：与SAP S/4HANA、SuccessFactors等SAP产品原生集成，保持业务语义

统一体验：共享SAP Fiori设计语言和操作习惯

预构建内容：提供丰富的SAP业务内容包和最佳实践模板

相比其他数据平台在获取到数据后需要完成的复杂业务语义重建工作，Datasphere为SAP客户提供了"即插即用"的数据管理能力，特别适合以SAP为核心的企业IT环境。

 

 

Datasphere该怎么用呢？

使用Datasphere就像为企业搭建"智能数据中枢"，主要步骤包括：

1. 获取，配置环境，分配权限

2. 建立数据表和对应的数据集成管道

  • 可以无缝对接SAP私有云系统，公有云系统
  • 还可以通过低代码开发对接各种非SAP数据
  • 甚至可以通过零拷贝的方式使用对象存储技术的数据源，无需真正导入数据，即可开始建模，消费

3. 数据建模和转换

  • 利用低代码工具创建数据模型和业务视图
  • 配置数据转换逻辑和业务规则

4. 部署和消费

  • 将数据模型部署到生产环境
  • 通过SAP Analytics Cloud或其他工具消费模型计算后的数据进行分析
  • 整个过程采用自助式操作，业务用户通过直观的界面就能完成专业的数据管理工作，大大降低了技术门槛，让每个业务专家都能成为数据建模者。

entry.title: Re: Export Crystal Report Design Preview to PDF
entry.content:
Hi Kadalene,

Unfortunately, Crystal Reports doesn't offer a setting (neither in the registry nor in a configuration file) to change the default export format from .rpt to .pdf. The export dialog doesn't remember your last choice and is hard-coded to always begin with .rpt.
Cheers, Andy

entry.title: Import bulk of custom fields in Data Migration modeler (LTMOM) using Upload Structure Field List
entry.content:
Challenge: When migrating complex master data like Business Partner - General Data (BP) to S/4HANA, you often receive requirements for over a hundred custom Z-fields sourced from a legacy system like CRM. Manually adding these fields one-by-one in the #LTMOM (Migration Object Modeler) is incredibly time-consuming and prone to errors.

Solution: Leverage the Upload Structure Field List option within LTMOM, as this feature allows you to bulk import field definitions using a simple text file, and it drastically reduce development time as well.

Summary of Step-by-Step Guide: Uploading Custom Z-Fields

Example with BP General data Z-Fields:
The following steps focuses on creating a new, user-defined migration object to handle the custom fields for the BP General Data (BUT000 table), using Function Module as the target.

How to create the Custom Migration Object
Execute transaction code LTMOM (Migration Object Modeler).

Select and Open the Project which was created in LTMC already.

In the menu bar, navigate to Project → Create Migration Object → User-Defined → Migrate Data Using Files/Staging Tables.


Enter the required Object ID and the description. Then choose the Function Module as the Target Structure option, then click Next.


Prepare the Source Structure File
Before creating the source structure, you must prepare the text file containing the field definitions.

  • File Format: Use a Text File with a Semicolon (;) delimiter. (Note: Standard comma-separated values (CSV) often fail with a pop-up error, even if the data is clean.)
  • Data Structure (Meta Format): The file needs to adhere to a specific structure for each Z-Field:
    Key FieldNameData TypeLengthDecimal PlacesAmount FieldLong Field LabelGroup TextCheck TableTooltipCustom Field

 






Create and Upload the Source Structure
In the LTMOM sidebar, double-click on Source Structure.

Right-click on the right sidebar and choose Append Structure to Lower Level. Enter the desired      name for your source structure (e.g., ZS_BP_CUSTOM).
Click the Upload Structure Field List option.

Browse and select your semicolon-delimited text file. The system will now generate all 100+ fields automatically.

Save changes and successfully created source structure using upload file.

Conclusion: Efficiency Through Correct Delimiter
As you can see the step-by-step guidance, by utilizing the Upload Structure Field List along with the semicolon-delimited text file, the development time can be significantly reduced. This approach streamlines the addition of high volume of custom fields in the existing Function Modules with maximum efficiency and minimal manual effort.

entry.title: Re: BEJ Inventory Valuation for Year-End Closing - on sto...
entry.content:
Hi there,

 
No, it is not possible to run different valuation practices for different storage locations within one company code/plant in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud .

Key Limitations

Material valuation occurs at the plant level only - In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, each plant represents a valuation area, meaning valuation is performed at the plant level rather than at storage location level . This is a fundamental design principle that cannot be changed.

Storage location valuation is not supported - Even in on-premise systems, SAP does not support material valuation at storage location level. The system only supports split valuation based on valuation type, not storage location .

Technical Background

The valuation area in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is fixed at the plant level . This means:

  • Price control and pricing are valid for one plant at a time
  • Material valuation data is created per plant
  • Different valuation practices can only be implemented across different plants, not within storage locations of the same plant

Alternative Solutions

1. Use Different Plants

If you need different valuation practices, consider setting up separate plants for different valuation requirements, as materials can be valuated differently in different plants .

2. Valuation Type Split

For materials requiring different valuations within the same plant, use split valuation based on valuation type rather than storage location .

3. Special Stock Management

For specific scenarios like consignment or special stock, the system provides alternative stock management approaches that don't rely on storage location-level valuation .

Price Difference Distribution

When price differences occur, the system automatically distributes them proportionally across all storage locations within the plant based on stock quantities, as shown in the automatic distribution functionality [4]. This ensures consistent valuation across all storage locations within the same plant.

The restriction to plant-level valuation is a core architectural decision in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud that cannot be customized or changed through configuration.

 

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudo. This motivates me to serve you better.

entry.title: Re: What I Wish I Knew
entry.content:
Hello Team,

As a customer embarking on the journey with SuccessFactors, there are a few critical points I wish I knew.

First and foremost, it is essential to stick to SAP standard as much as possible. Align your processes and configurations with the best practices recommended by SAP.  It is very tempting to customise the system to fit your previous ways of working, but it's important to let go of your old system(s) thinking.

Additionally, I encourage you to automate your processes as much as possible. A critical review of each process is necessary and to play devil's advocate and question why it can't be changed. 

When transitioning from SAP HCM payroll to Employee Central Payroll (ECP), it's important to understand the relationship between the two systems. Employee Central (EC) acts as the master, while ECP functions as the slave. This means that EC will be the primary source of data, and ECP will rely on it for payroll processing. 

By keeping these points in mind and approaching the implementation with an open mind and a willingness to adapt, you will be well on your way to a successful SuccessFactors experience.

That is what I wished somebody told me at the beginning.

Best regards,
Helette Slabber
